My Work

Palate Recipe App

This app allows a user to search for and discover recipes. The 'Saved Recipes' route is protected until the user signs up and becomes authenticated. Once the user is authenticated and logged in, they can save and delete their unique recipes. The recipe data is being pulled from the Edamam API and user data is being stored in Firebase. I also used React, React Router, Semantic UI, and CSS to build the user interface and to populate the page with recipes.

Launch Github

Project Refuge Website

This is a website I volunteered to work on through Biltran. Project Refuge is a nonprofit organization based in Brooklyn, who help developing communities in Uganda rise above poverty. My role was to build the majority of the website with a Wordpress page builder, custom CSS, and HTML. Client communication was handled through Google Drive for content and images.

Launch

Fat-Trax Website

Fat-Trax is a BMX, snowboard, and skateboard shop located in East Longmeadow, Massachusetts. Using Wordpress, Docker, and Gitlab, I built their new website in a local environment. Then, I pushed the site to production with a Digital Ocean droplet. I also used GIMP to make the backgrounds of the logos transparent. The Gitlab repository is private.

Launch

Giphy Search Engine

This web app allows you to search for a specific GIF and pick how many GIFs you want to be displayed on the page. There is also a route for popular GIFs and for a random GIF. This was a fun, personal project I built to become more familiar with getting data from an external API. I built this app with React, React Router, Material-UI, CSS, HTML, and the Giphy API. It is hosted on Netlify.

Launch Github

W3 Layouts Template Clone

As a personal experiment, I decided to see if I could replicate a template without looking at the source code. I found a design I liked on w3layouts and built it using React, React Router, React Bootstrap, and CSS. The content on the site is just lorem ipsum dummy text.
